title: Selena Gomez rocks sleek black-and-white pinstripe suit for dinner with Goodbye Honolulu in New York
text:
She merged her fan-status into friendship.

And Selena Gomez looked simply sleek as she stepped out for dinner with the band Goodbye Honolulu in New York on Tuesday night.

The 27-year-old songstress dressed up for the wild night wearing a black-and-white pinstriped ensemble to eat at La Esquina restaurant in the SoHo neighborhood of Manhattan.

Beauty: Selena Gomez looked simply sleek as she stepped out for dinner with the band Goodbye Honolulu in New York on Tuesday night

Selena seemed to leave her top at home as she stepped out in a long-sleeved jacket with buttons running vertically up her torso.

She paired her monochrome ensemble with matching slacks and pounded the pavement in white trainers.

The Hands To Myself singer sported cherry red nail polish for an added pop of color to an otherwise muted ensemble.

Chic: The 27-year-old songstress dressed up for the wild night wearing a black-and-white pinstriped ensemble to eat at La Esquina restaurant in the SoHo neighborhood of Manhattan

She tied back her long, chocolate brown hair into a loose ponytail and let a few wispy tendrils frame her face.

Selena was joined by the Goodbye Honolulu band just one day after catching their concert in Brooklyn.

The band's guitarist and lead singer, Fox Atticus Martindale, is dating Gomez's friend Anna Collins.

Gorgeous: She tied back her long, chocolate brown hair into a loose ponytail and let a few wispy tendrils frame her face

She recently released two new singles back-to-back, one of which is believed to be inspired by her ex Justin Bieber.

They had a very on-again, off-again relationship, which lasted from 2010 to 2018, until Bieber tied the knot with Hailey Baldwin.

A source recently told Us Weekly of Lose You to Love Me: 'The song was inspired by Selena’s breakup from Justin, but it would be incorrect to say it’s totally about Justin.
description: The 27-year-old dressed up for the wild night wearing a black-and-white pinstriped ensemble to eat at La Esquina restaurant in the SoHo neighborhood of Manhattan.
